issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: ClientTokens should be per app-attempt and be unregistered on App-finish.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: ClientToAMSecretManager creates keys without checking for validity of the appID

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Helps to add it to the context instead of passing it all around as an extra parameter.

comments.body:
{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12548349/YARN-136-20121008.txt
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 13 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:red}-1 core tests{color}.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager:

                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.TestAppManager

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

This message is automatically generated.

The test did fail for me in a clean environment. Likely related to mockRMContext in TestAppManager.
Other than that, looks good except for a couple of renames. RMContext.getClientTokenSecretManager -> getClientToAMSecretManager. Similarly for variable names.
Updated patch addressing review comments and the test-issue.
